newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek shares jump 2.74pct as interest rates fall Greek sh.
newsitem.headline: Greek shares jump 2.74pct as interest rates fall Greek sh.

text.p: Greek shares climbed 2.74 percent on Thursday helped by a sharp rise in banks and a wide range of industrials which brokers justified on grounds of improved profitability and easing interest rates.

"Large caps such as National Bank and OTE set the trend for the broader market. Industrials which gathered momentum in recent sessions helped lift the index along with banks," said Mathios Doulos, a broker at Kyranis Securities.
The drop in interest rates favours profit growth on leveraged industrial companies and Treasury paper-rich banks, he added.
The Athens general index climbed 2.74 percent or 44.84 points to 1,683.85 from Wednesday's close at 1,639.01.
At the close 7.5 million shares had been traded, valued at 33 billion drachmas, including several blocks -- mostly in banks.
Advancers led decliners 174 to 53 with 29 stocks unchanged on 256 traded.
Greece will issue 12-month T-bills at 9.6 percent, down 10 basis points, on June 2.
